p: In the past few years, it has been established that sphingolipids play a vital protective role in lungs from pulmonary leak and lung injury, and the modulation of their pathways may offer effective therapeutic intervention strategies [ 73]. Modulation of sphingolipids can be very beneficial and can offer an anti-inflammatory, neuroprotective, and anti-coagulant effects [ 74, 75]. All of these exciting features could likely be exploited to counteract the associated complications of COVID-19 infection [ 76].
